result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynn M. Kosidowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lynn M. Kosidowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lynn M. Kosidowski was found guilty of Violate State/County Institution Laws, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.
  • Lynn M. Kosidowski was found guilty of Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant is not to be on the premises of any Correctional Institution (County Jail, Mental Health Hospital, and/or State of Wisconsin Prison).   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:05 pm case called. Defendant Lynn M. Kosidowski in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State will move to amend Count 1 to Violation of a Law Governing the Premises of a Penal Institution in violation of 946.73- a Misd. Class C.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts motion of State to amend count 1.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court enters outright dismissal of Counts 3 & 4. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year. if revoked, 2 days credit.  CONDITIONS: Not to be on the premises of any Correctional Institution (County Jail, Mental Health Hospital, and/or State of Wisconsin Prison). AODA and follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 24, 2014 at 09:20 am.
Status conference on May 13, 2014 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:12 PM: Defendant Lynn M. Kosidowski in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on April 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Not to be in the possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription as to the medication and proper quantity. No contact with the Redgranite Correctional Institution whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:21 p.m. Defendant Lynn M. Kosidowski in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Keberlein. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond w/ conditions. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
